entries.title: Tata Sierra EV to Launch in India by Mid-2025: What We Know So Far
entries.excerpt: The iconic Tata Sierra is making a comeback as an all-electric SUV. Here's everything we know about the upcoming Sierra EV launch in India.
entries.content:
Tata Motors is preparing to bring back the iconic Sierra nameplate, this time as a fully electric SUV. The Tata Sierra EV, first showcased as a concept at Auto Expo 2020 and later in near-production form at Auto Expo 2023, is expected to launch in India by mid-2025.

The Sierra EV will be built on Tata's Gen 2 Acti.ev platform, which also underpins the Curvv EV. This platform supports multiple battery pack options and is designed for longer range and faster charging.

Design-wise, the production Sierra EV retains the boxy, retro-inspired design of the original 1990s Sierra, combined with modern LED lighting, a floating roof design, and the signature greenhouse that made the original so distinctive.

Inside, expect a premium cabin with a large touchscreen infotainment system, digital instrument cluster, connected car features, and sustainable materials. The Sierra EV will compete with the Mahindra XUV.e8 and upcoming electric SUVs from Hyundai and Kia.

Pricing is expected to start around Rs 25-30 lakh (ex-showroom), positioning it in the premium electric SUV segment. With the growing EV infrastructure in India, the Sierra EV could become a game-changer for Tata in the electric mobility space.

entries.title: Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara Unveiled: India's First Electric SUV from Maruti
entries.excerpt: Maruti Suzuki has finally entered the EV race with the e-Vitara, a global electric SUV that will launch in India by early 2025.
entries.content:
Maruti Suzuki has officially unveiled the e-Vitara, marking the company's long-awaited entry into the electric vehicle segment. The e-Vitara is a global product developed in collaboration with Toyota and will be manufactured at Suzuki's Gujarat plant.

The e-Vitara features a bold design with Y-shaped LED DRLs, a closed-off grille, sculpted body panels, and 18-inch dual-tone alloy wheels. The design language is distinctly different from any current Maruti model, signaling a new era for the brand.

Two battery pack options will be offered: a 49 kWh pack with around 400 km range and a 61 kWh pack promising over 500 km on a single charge. An all-wheel-drive variant with dual motors will also be available, producing approximately 180 bhp.

The interior showcases a premium approach with a 10.25-inch touchscreen, 10.1-inch digital driver's display, wireless phone charger, panoramic sunroof, and Suzuki's connected car technology.

Expect the e-Vitara to be priced between Rs 20-25 lakh, making it more affordable than many competitors. Bookings are expected to open in January 2025, with deliveries starting by March 2025.

entries.title: Mahindra BE 6e Launched at Rs 18.90 Lakh: The Future of Electric SUVs
entries.excerpt: Mahindra has launched the BE 6e electric SUV in India, the first model from the new Born Electric platform, starting at Rs 18.90 lakh.
entries.content:
Mahindra has officially launched the BE 6e in India, the first vehicle from the company's new 'Born Electric' platform. The BE 6e is priced from Rs 18.90 lakh to Rs 26.90 lakh (ex-showroom) and represents Mahindra's most advanced electric vehicle yet.

The BE 6e features a stunning coupe-SUV design with sharp LED lighting, a sloping roofline, and aggressive stance. The interior is equally futuristic with a triple-screen setup, including a large central touchscreen and a separate screen for the front passenger.

Two battery options are available: a 59 kWh pack offering 450 km range and a larger 79 kWh pack with up to 600 km range. The performance variant produces 286 bhp and can sprint from 0-100 km/h in under 7 seconds.

Key features include Level 2 ADAS, 175 kW fast charging capability (20-80% in 20 minutes), over-the-air updates, and a sophisticated battery management system.

The BE 6e competes with the Tata Curvv EV and upcoming models from Hyundai and Kia. Deliveries will begin from March 2025.

entries.title: 2024 Kia Seltos Facelift Launched with New Features and Design Updates
entries.excerpt: Kia has launched the facelifted Seltos in India with a refreshed design, new features, and ADAS technology across variants.
entries.content:
Kia India has launched the 2024 Seltos facelift with prices starting at Rs 10.90 lakh (ex-showroom). The mid-life update brings significant design changes, new features, and enhanced safety equipment.

The exterior features a new 'Digital Tiger Face' with redesigned LED headlamps and DRLs that extend into the bonnet. The bumpers are new, and there are fresh alloy wheel designs. The rear gets connected LED taillights for a more premium appearance.

Inside, the Seltos now features dual 10.25-inch screens in a connected layout, similar to the Kia Sonet. New features include a digital key, 360-degree camera, ventilated seats, and an improved UVO connected car system with 70+ features.

For the first time, Kia is offering Level 2 ADAS in the Seltos, including features like lane keep assist, adaptive cruise control, forward collision warning, and blind spot detection.

Engine options remain unchanged: 1.5-liter naturally aspirated petrol (115 bhp), 1.5-liter turbo-petrol (160 bhp), and a 1.5-liter diesel (116 bhp). Transmission choices include manual, iMT, DCT, and torque converter automatic.

The Kia Seltos continues to rival the Hyundai Creta, Maruti Grand Vitara, and Volkswagen Taigun.

entries.title: Hyundai Creta Electric: India Launch Expected in Early 2025
entries.excerpt: Hyundai is preparing to launch the electric version of its best-selling Creta SUV in India by early 2025.
entries.content:
Hyundai Motor India is gearing up to launch the Creta Electric in early 2025, adding an EV variant to its best-selling SUV lineup. The Creta Electric has been spotted testing multiple times and is expected to debut at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025.

The Creta Electric will be based on a modified version of the current Creta platform, optimized for electric powertrains. Design changes will include a closed-off grille, unique alloy wheels, and EV-specific badging.

Two battery pack options are expected: a smaller pack for urban commuters with around 350 km range and a larger pack offering up to 450 km of range. Fast charging support will enable 10-80% charging in approximately 40 minutes.

The interior will largely mirror the regular Creta with dual 10.25-inch screens, Bose audio, ventilated seats, and BlueLink connected car technology. EV-specific features will include regenerative braking controls and range estimation.

Pricing is expected between Rs 18-22 lakh, making it competitive with the Tata Curvv EV and MG ZS EV. The Creta Electric will be manufactured at Hyundai's Chennai plant.

entries.title: Tata Curvv and Curvv EV: Complete Price List and Variant Breakdown
entries.excerpt: Tata has launched both ICE and EV versions of the Curvv coupe-SUV. Here's the complete price list and variant-wise features.
entries.content:
Tata Motors has launched the much-anticipated Curvv in both internal combustion and electric versions. The Curvv marks Tata's entry into the coupe-SUV segment, competing with the Citroen Basalt.

The Tata Curvv ICE is priced from Rs 10 lakh to Rs 19 lakh and is available with two engine options: a 1.2-liter turbo-petrol producing 125 bhp and a 1.5-liter diesel with 118 bhp. Both engines are available with manual and automatic transmissions.

The Curvv EV, launched earlier, is priced from Rs 17.49 lakh to Rs 21.99 lakh. It offers two battery options: 45 kWh with 502 km range and 55 kWh with 585 km claimed range.

Design highlights include a sloping roofline, connected LED lighting, flush door handles, and 18-inch alloy wheels. The interior features a 12.3-inch touchscreen, 10.25-inch digital cluster, 9-speaker JBL audio, panoramic sunroof, and Level 2 ADAS.

The Curvv is the first Tata car with the new 'Digital' design language and sets the template for future Tata vehicles. Both versions offer excellent value for money in their respective segments.

entries.title: Mahindra Thar Roxx 5-Door Launched: Prices Start at Rs 12.99 Lakh
entries.excerpt: Mahindra has launched the Thar Roxx, a 5-door version of the iconic Thar with improved practicality and features.
entries.content:
Mahindra has launched the highly anticipated Thar Roxx, a 5-door version of the iconic Thar off-roader. Priced from Rs 12.99 lakh to Rs 22.49 lakh (ex-showroom), the Thar Roxx offers improved practicality while retaining hardcore off-road capabilities.

The Thar Roxx is 480mm longer than the 3-door Thar, with a 2,850mm wheelbase providing significantly better rear seat space. The 5-door format makes ingress and egress much easier for rear passengers.

Two engine options are available: a 2.0-liter turbo-petrol producing 177 bhp and a 2.2-liter diesel with 175 bhp. Both engines are available with 6-speed manual and automatic transmissions, and 4x4 is optional on select variants.

The interior is a significant upgrade with a 10.25-inch touchscreen, digital instrument cluster, panoramic sunroof, ventilated seats, and a 9-speaker Harman Kardon audio system. Safety features include 6 airbags, ESP, and ADAS on top variants.

Despite the creature comforts, the Thar Roxx retains its off-road prowess with mechanical locking differentials, low-range gearbox, and 226mm ground clearance.

entries.title: New Skoda Kodiaq 2025 Launched in India at Rs 39.99 Lakh
entries.excerpt: Skoda has launched the second-generation Kodiaq in India with a new design, more features, and improved dynamics.
entries.content:
Skoda Auto India has launched the all-new 2025 Kodiaq at Rs 39.99 lakh (ex-showroom). The second-generation Kodiaq features a completely new design, upgraded interior, and enhanced driving dynamics.

The new Kodiaq adopts Skoda's latest Modern Solid design language with a wider grille, split LED headlamps, and a more imposing stance. At 4,758mm, it's 61mm longer than the outgoing model, translating to more cabin space.

Inside, the Kodiaq gets a 13-inch touchscreen, 10-inch digital cluster, three-zone climate control, ambient lighting, and ergo seats with massage function. The third row now offers better legroom for adults.

Power comes from a 2.0-liter TSI turbo-petrol engine producing 190 bhp and 320 Nm, paired exclusively with a 7-speed DSG. All-wheel drive is standard. The 0-100 km/h sprint takes 8.6 seconds.

The new Kodiaq competes with the Toyota Fortuner, MG Gloster, and Jeep Meridian in the premium 7-seater SUV segment.

entries.title: Citroen Basalt Coupe-SUV Launched at Rs 7.99 Lakh: Most Affordable Coupe-SUV
entries.excerpt: Citroen has disrupted the coupe-SUV segment with the Basalt, priced attractively starting at just Rs 7.99 lakh.
entries.content:
Citroen India has launched the Basalt coupe-SUV at an introductory price of Rs 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it the most affordable coupe-SUV in India. The Basalt is based on the C3 Aircross platform but features a distinctive sloping roofline.

Design highlights include split headlamps, a bold grille with the signature Citroen chevrons, and the characteristic coupe silhouette. Despite the sloping roof, Citroen claims minimal compromise on rear headroom.

The Basalt is powered by two engine options: a 1.2-liter naturally aspirated petrol (82 bhp) and a 1.2-liter turbo-petrol (110 bhp). Transmission options include a 5-speed manual and 6-speed torque converter automatic.

Inside, the Basalt gets a 10.2-inch touchscreen with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, automatic climate control, and adjustable rear seat recline - a segment-first feature.

At these prices, the Citroen Basalt undercuts the Tata Curvv by a significant margin and offers a unique value proposition for style-conscious buyers.

entries.title: Mahindra XEV 9e Electric SUV: Specifications, Range, and Expected Price
entries.excerpt: Mahindra's flagship electric SUV, the XEV 9e, promises over 650 km range and luxury features. Here's what to expect.
entries.content:
Following the BE 6e, Mahindra is preparing to launch the XEV 9e, the flagship model from the Born Electric platform. The XEV 9e is a large electric SUV that will compete with premium offerings from established luxury brands.

The XEV 9e features a bold design with a long bonnet, sleek LED lighting, and a commanding presence. At approximately 4.9 meters in length, it's significantly larger than the BE 6e and offers more interior space.

The XEV 9e will be available with a massive 79 kWh battery pack, offering a claimed range of over 650 km. A smaller 59 kWh option will also be available for those who prioritize affordability over range.

Premium features include a panoramic glass roof, quad-screen setup inside, Level 2+ ADAS, air suspension, and a premium audio system. The interior showcases sustainable materials and a minimalist design.

Expect the XEV 9e to be priced between Rs 30-40 lakh, positioning it as a premium alternative to luxury EVs from German brands. Launch is expected in the second half of 2025.

entries.title: Toyota Urban Cruiser Taisor Launched: Maruti Fronx-Based Crossover
entries.excerpt: Toyota has launched the Urban Cruiser Taisor, a rebadged version of the Maruti Suzuki Fronx, with minor styling updates.
entries.content:
Toyota Kirloskar Motor has launched the Urban Cruiser Taisor in India at prices ranging from Rs 7.74 lakh to Rs 13.04 lakh (ex-showroom). The Taisor is essentially a rebadged Maruti Suzuki Fronx as part of the Toyota-Suzuki alliance.

While mechanically identical to the Fronx, the Taisor features subtle design differences including a modified front grille with Toyota badging, different alloy wheel designs, and unique color options.

Engine options mirror the Fronx: a 1.2-liter K-series petrol with 90 bhp and a 1.0-liter Boosterjet turbo-petrol producing 100 bhp. Both engines are available with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter automatic transmissions.

The Taisor also offers a CNG option with the 1.2-liter engine, producing 77 bhp and offering excellent fuel economy for high-mileage users.

Features include a 9-inch SmartPlay touchscreen, 360-degree camera, heads-up display, and connected car tech. Safety kit includes 6 airbags and ESP as standard.

The Taisor benefits from Toyota's extensive dealer network and is expected to attract buyers who prefer the Toyota badge over Maruti.

entries.title: Tata Harrier and Safari Now Available with Petrol Engine Option
entries.excerpt: Tata Motors expands Harrier and Safari lineup with new turbo-petrol engine variants, addressing customer demand.
entries.content:
Tata Motors has launched petrol variants of the Harrier and Safari SUVs, expanding the powertrain options for its flagship models. Both SUVs now come with a 1.5-liter turbo-petrol engine in addition to the existing diesel option.

The new Hyperion 1.5-liter turbo-petrol engine produces 170 bhp and 280 Nm of torque. It's paired with a 7-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. A 6-speed manual option will be available later.

Pricing for the petrol variants starts at Rs 14.99 lakh for the Harrier and Rs 16.49 lakh for the Safari. These prices are approximately Rs 50,000-70,000 lower than equivalent diesel variants.

The petrol engine offers several advantages including lower NVH levels, smoother power delivery, and lower maintenance costs compared to diesel. Fuel efficiency is rated at 14 km/l in city and 17 km/l on highways.

With this addition, Tata addresses the needs of customers who prefer petrol engines for lower annual running or those in regions where diesel vehicles face restrictions. All feature options remain identical to the diesel variants.

entries.title: India to Get 100,000 EV Charging Stations by 2026: Government Plan
entries.excerpt: The Indian government has announced an ambitious plan to install 100,000 EV charging stations across the country by 2026.
entries.content:
The Indian government has unveiled an ambitious plan to install 100,000 electric vehicle charging stations across the country by 2026, a significant boost to EV infrastructure.

Currently, India has approximately 12,000 public EV charging stations, with the majority concentrated in metro cities. The new plan aims to distribute charging infrastructure more evenly across tier-2 and tier-3 cities and along national highways.

The plan includes setting up fast-charging stations every 50 km on national highways and at least one charging station every 3 km in urban areas. Private players like Tata Power, EESL, and others will participate alongside government entities.

Incentives for setting up charging stations have been enhanced, including reduced GST, capital subsidies, and streamlined approval processes. Land allocation at government premises will also be made available.

This infrastructure push is expected to accelerate EV adoption in India, addressing range anxiety - one of the primary concerns among potential EV buyers. The government is also working on standardizing charging connectors to ensure interoperability.

entries.title: New Honda Amaze 2024 Generation Launched at Rs 5.99 Lakh
entries.excerpt: Honda has launched the all-new third-generation Amaze with fresh design, improved features, and enhanced safety.
entries.content:
Honda Cars India has launched the third-generation Amaze sedan at prices ranging from Rs 5.99 lakh to Rs 10.89 lakh (ex-showroom). The new Amaze features a completely new design and significantly improved equipment levels.

The design is a major departure from the previous generation, featuring Honda's latest design language with a wide grille, sleek LED headlamps, and a more premium overall appearance. The sedan looks more sophisticated and upmarket than before.

Inside, the new Amaze gets an 8-inch touchscreen with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, a semi-digital instrument cluster, single-zone automatic climate control, and ambient lighting. Safety features include 6 airbags, LaneWatch camera, and Vehicle Stability Assist as standard.

Power comes from the same 1.2-liter i-VTEC petrol engine producing 90 bhp, paired with either a 5-speed manual or CVT automatic. A CNG variant will be launched later.

The new Amaze continues to compete with the Maruti Dzire, Hyundai Aura, and Tata Tigor in the compact sedan segment. With its feature-rich package and competitive pricing, Honda aims to regain market share in this segment.

entries.title: Volkswagen ID.4 Electric SUV India Launch Delayed to 2025
entries.excerpt: Volkswagen has delayed the India launch of its ID.4 electric SUV to 2025, citing market readiness and infrastructure concerns.
entries.content:
Volkswagen has pushed back the India launch of the ID.4 electric SUV to the second half of 2025, originally planned for late 2024. The German automaker cited evolving market conditions and infrastructure development as reasons for the delay.

The ID.4 will be brought to India as a completely built unit (CBU), which means higher pricing compared to locally manufactured EVs. Volkswagen is evaluating the market response before considering local assembly.

Globally, the ID.4 is available with two battery options: a 52 kWh pack with 275 km range and a 77 kWh pack offering up to 520 km. India will likely get the larger battery variant to justify the premium pricing.

The ID.4 features a spacious interior thanks to the MEB platform, a 12-inch touchscreen, augmented reality head-up display, and comprehensive safety features. Performance from the rear motor stands at 204 bhp.

Expected pricing for the ID.4 in India is around Rs 50-60 lakh, positioning it against the upcoming BMW iX1 and Mercedes EQA. While expensive, the ID.4 offers a taste of global EV technology that's currently unavailable in India.

entries.title: Kia EV6 Gets a Price Cut of Rs 3 Lakh in India
entries.excerpt: Kia India has reduced the price of the EV6 by Rs 3 lakh, making the performance electric crossover more accessible.
entries.content:
Kia India has announced a significant price reduction for the EV6 electric crossover, cutting Rs 3 lakh from its price. The EV6 is now priced at Rs 57.95 lakh (ex-showroom), down from its earlier Rs 60.95 lakh.

The price cut comes as part of Kia's strategy to boost EV adoption in the premium segment. The EV6, which is sold as a CBU import, faces stiff competition from other premium EVs in India.

The EV6 is powered by a 77.4 kWh battery pack offering a range of 528 km. The rear-wheel-drive variant produces 229 bhp, while the all-wheel-drive GT-Line makes 325 bhp with a 0-100 km/h time of 5.2 seconds.

Premium features include a curved dual-screen display, augmented reality head-up display, relaxation seats with leg support, Vehicle-to-Load (V2L) capability, and advanced driver assistance systems.

With this price cut, the EV6 becomes more competitive against the Mercedes EQB and Volvo XC40 Recharge. Kia hopes this move will attract more customers to the premium EV segment.

entries.title: Renault Duster 2025: New Generation SUV Spotted Testing in India
entries.excerpt: The new-generation Renault Duster has been spotted testing in India ahead of its expected 2025 launch.
entries.content:
The third-generation Renault Duster has been spotted testing on Indian roads, indicating that Renault is preparing to bring back the iconic SUV after a hiatus. The new Duster is expected to launch in India by mid-2025.

Based on the CMF-B platform (shared with the Nissan Magnite and Renault Kiger), the new Duster features a completely new design with Y-shaped LED DRLs, a bold grille, and muscular body cladding. The design is a significant departure from previous generations.

The test mule appeared to be a high-spec variant with features like LED headlamps, alloy wheels, and roof rails. Interior spy shots reveal a dual-screen layout, premium materials, and a redesigned dashboard.

Engine options are expected to include the 1.0-liter turbo-petrol from Nissan/Renault and possibly a 1.3-liter turbo-petrol unit. A strong hybrid version is also rumored to be in development.

The new Duster will compete in the compact SUV segment against the Hyundai Creta, Kia Seltos, and Maruti Grand Vitara. Renault is expected to price it competitively to gain market share.

entries.title: MG Windsor EV Sales Cross 10,000 Units in First 3 Months
entries.excerpt: MG Motor's Windsor EV has achieved 10,000 sales milestone in just 3 months, becoming India's fastest-selling electric crossover.
entries.content:
MG Motor India has announced that the Windsor EV has crossed the 10,000 sales milestone within just three months of its launch, making it one of the fastest-selling electric vehicles in India.

The Windsor EV's success is attributed to its innovative Battery-as-a-Service (BaaS) model, which allows customers to buy the car at a lower upfront cost (Rs 9.99 lakh) and pay a monthly rental for the battery. The outright purchase option is priced at Rs 13.50 lakh.

The Windsor EV features a 38 kWh battery pack offering a range of 331 km. The interior is luxurious with aeroplane-style seats, a large panoramic sunroof, and premium upholstery. The 15.6-inch touchscreen with i-SMART connectivity is another highlight.

MG reports that 60% of Windsor EV customers opted for the BaaS model, indicating strong acceptance of the subscription approach to EV ownership. Most customers are first-time EV buyers upgrading from ICE vehicles.

The success of the Windsor EV is expected to influence other manufacturers to explore similar ownership models to make EVs more accessible to the mass market.

entries.title: Next-Gen Maruti Swift vs Old Swift: What's Changed?
entries.excerpt: We compare the new 2024 Maruti Swift with the outgoing model to highlight all the changes and improvements.
entries.content:
The fourth-generation Maruti Swift has arrived with significant changes over the outgoing model. Here's a comprehensive comparison of what's new and what's changed.

**Design**: The new Swift features a completely fresh design with sharper LED headlamps, a new grille, and a more dynamic stance. The side profile gets a floating roof effect with blacked-out C-pillars. The rear features connected LED taillamps.

**Dimensions**: The new Swift is slightly shorter but wider than before. Wheelbase remains similar at 2,450mm, ensuring similar cabin space.

**Engine**: The new 1.2-liter Z-Series engine replaces the K-Series unit. While power drops from 90 to 82 bhp, fuel efficiency improves significantly to 25 km/l (up from 22 km/l).

**Features**: The new model gets a larger 9-inch touchscreen (up from 7 inches), wireless Apple CarPlay/Android Auto, cruise control, and automatic headlamps. Wireless charging is a new addition.

**Safety**: The biggest improvement is in safety. All variants now get 6 airbags as standard, along with ESP and hill hold. The previous model had only 2 airbags in base variants.

**Price**: Prices have increased by Rs 40,000-60,000 across variants, but the added features and safety equipment justify the premium.

entries.title: BYD Sealion 7 Electric SUV India Launch Expected by Early 2025
entries.excerpt: BYD is preparing to launch the Sealion 7, a premium electric SUV with up to 600 km range, in India by early 2025.
entries.content:
Chinese EV giant BYD is gearing up to launch the Sealion 7 electric SUV in India by early 2025. The Sealion 7 will be positioned above the current Atto 3 and will compete in the premium electric SUV segment.

The Sealion 7 features a sleek coupe-SUV design with a low drag coefficient of 0.23. The exterior showcases BYD's new design language with a closed-off front, slim LED headlights, and a distinctive light bar connecting the taillamps.

Two battery options are expected: a 82.5 kWh pack with around 500 km range and a larger 91.3 kWh pack offering up to 600 km. The top variant with dual motors produces 530 bhp with 0-100 km/h in 4.5 seconds.

The interior features a 15.6-inch rotating touchscreen (similar to Atto 3), a digital instrument cluster, HUD, and premium materials. Level 2 ADAS is standard with features like adaptive cruise control and lane centering.

Expected pricing in India is around Rs 45-55 lakh, positioning it against the Kia EV6 and upcoming premium EVs from German brands. BYD's proven Blade battery technology adds a safety and durability advantage.
